comment._content:
If any of these originals were Vintage 3D Stereoviews, would it be possible to post both the left and right images (in one file)? The highest resolution possible would be appreciated. The Internet is a great place to backup priceless art in case of disaster.
Great work, and THANKS!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: @Logan Six - sorry, no stereos on these

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: The statues to the left and right of the Arch of Triumph are called the Genius of Navigation. Oddly, the 1894 edition of the Art and Architecture of the Women's Building has an entirely different statue for the illustration of The Genius of Navigation. The Illinois Institute of Technology, among other sites, confirm the photo'd statues as Genius of Navigation. Designed by Bela Pratt. Peristyle architect was Charles Atwood.
